languageTools.program.agent.actions

Class ExitModuleAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.actions.Action
        • languageTools.program.agent.actions.ExitModuleAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class ExitModuleAction
extends Action
    Forces an exit from the current (non-anonymous) Module.

    Modules create an (implicit) stack of contexts when they are called, where 'moduleN' is the last module that has been entered. Executing the exit-module action means that all anonymous modules higher on the stack than the first non-anonymous module are exited as well as the first non-anonymous module. Execution then continues in the module one level lower in the stack.

    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      ExitModuleAction(InputStreamPosition source)
      Creates an ExitModuleAction that forces an exit from the current (non-anonymous) module, i.e., the highest non-anonymous modules on the (implicit) module stack; all higher anonymous modules are also exited.

      • applySubst

        public Action applySubst(Substitution substitution)

      • getPrecondition

        public MentalStateCondition getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
                                throws GOALParseException
        The precondition of an ExitModuleAction is true, or, to be more precise "bel(true)"; this means it can always be performed if the action is closed.
        Specified by:
        getPrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language used for representing the precondition.
        Returns:
        The MentalStateCondition "bel(true)".
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - In case the KR parser had a problem parsing "true".

      • evaluatePrecondition

        public ExitModuleAction evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                                    Debugger debugger,
                                    boolean last)
        Checks whether the precondition of this ExitModuleAction holds. See also: getPrecondition(KRlanguage)).
        Specified by:
        evaluatePrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        true since the exit module action has an "empty" precondition.
